title: How is corporate culture changing? - Quora

response.answer_text: My take is that almost every time an ivory tower academician publishes, culture changes. In the big picture, those mouthpieces herd us into groups so that we won’t insist on being an individual. The few dissenting voices are marginalized and do not change the culture from its trajectory. Corporate culture changes accordingly. Carver Wrightman alias Cecil R. Williams

In my view — Worldwide corporate culture is changing to adapt to the reality of Economic Globalism. This places multinational Corporations at the forefront of corporate culture. This also places computerized Supply Chain contracts at the cutting edge. Corporate culture is far more open to diversity than ever before, and it is far more computerized than ever before, and it is driven by competition to be far more cooperative with its international trading partners than ever before. There’s my view.

More distance communication, more agile, more diversity, more orientation towards emerging technologies like AI and Machine Learning which improve efficiency and more prioritisation of positive customer experiences
